intro: Anil nudicaulis, commonly known as the narrow-leaved anil, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes many economically important crops such as cabbage and mustard. The plant is characterized by its small, delicate flowers that typically bloom in shades of white or pale purple. It has a low-growing habit with linear leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Anil nudicaulis is adapted to cold, arid environments and is often found in rocky or alpine habitats.
